benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: PUT > Valid Request: Multiple success paths verify 204 and DB updates/creation for valid payloads (TC01–TC05, TC21–TC22).
PUT > Non-Existing Resource: 404 covered for missing invoice items and empty DB (TC07, TC24, TC25).
Validation: Path parameter UUID format (TC06), malformed JSON (TC08), empty body (TC10), unsupported fields (TC11), required header presence (TC09).
Large Payload Handling: Boundary and over-limit behavior (204 vs 413) considered (TC12, TC21).
Robustness/Server Errors: 500 DB unavailable (TC15), 503 dependency down (TC19), 504 timeout (TC16).
Idempotency: Repeated identical PUTs yield consistent state (TC17).
State Variations: Items with/without existing custom fields and empty/partial DB states (TC04–TC05, TC24–TC25).
Security Input Hardening: Injection-like invalid values rejected (TC14).
gaps: PUT > Concurrency Issues: No scenarios for concurrent updates to the same invoiceItemId (race conditions, last-write-wins, optimistic locking, ETag/If-Match).
PUT > Partial Update Semantics: No explicit test to confirm whether partial updates are rejected or allowed (e.g., updating a subset vs full replacement of custom fields).
Schema-Level Validation Depth: No tests for invalid data types, nulls, exceeding field length, duplicate keys, or immutability rules within CustomField schema (e.g., non-editable name/key).
Headers Validation Detail: No tests for invalid/empty X-Killbill-CreatedBy, or overly long/invalid characters in Reason/Comment.
Response Contract on 204: No verification of response headers (e.g., absence of body on 204, content-type expectations) or audit headers if applicable.
Parallel Performance on Same Resource: Performance tests cover parallelism across items (TC20) but not contention on the same invoice item.
recommendations: Add concurrency scenarios for simultaneous updates to the same invoice item: two clients PUT different payloads at the same time; define and verify conflict handling (e.g., 409 with If-Match/version) or last-write-wins with audit trail.
Clarify and test partial update behavior: send a payload updating only a subset of fields; assert whether it is rejected (400/422) or supported (and then verify only specified fields change).

Expand schema validation: tests for invalid data types, null/empty values, over-length strings, duplicate custom field keys, reserved/immutable fields, and enum/range violations per CustomField definition.
Harden header validation: scenarios for missing/empty/whitespace CreatedBy, excessive length, invalid characters; optional headers with invalid formats; ensure proper 400/422 responses.

Verify response contract: on 204 ensure no response body and appropriate headers; if API specifies produces application/json, confirm behavior or correct it; include request-id/correlation/audit headers if standard.
Add performance and contention tests on the same invoice item: many parallel PUTs on one resource; measure correctness and performance under write contention.
